SEARCH
Package com.landawn.abacus.util

Class Synchronized<T>

java.lang.Object
com.landawn.abacus.util.Synchronized<T>
Type Parameters:
T - The type of the object on which the synchronized operations are to be performed.
T -
public final class Synchronized<T> extends Object
This class provides a way to perform synchronized operations on a given object. It provides static methods to perform operations like run, call, test, accept, and apply on a given object in a synchronized manner. It also provides instance methods to perform these operations on the object provided at the time of creation of the Synchronized object.

  • Method Details

    • on

      public static <T> Synchronized<T> on(T mutex) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Creates a new Synchronized object on the provided mutex. This method is useful when you want to perform synchronized operations on a given object. The returned Synchronized object provides methods to perform operations like run, call, test, accept, and apply on the mutex in a synchronized manner.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of the mutex.
      Parameters:
      mutex - The object on which the synchronized operations are to be performed.
      Returns:
      A new Synchronized object on the provided mutex.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the provided mutex is null.

    • run

      public static <T, E extends Throwable> void run(T mutex, Throwables.Runnable<E> cmd) throws IllegalArgumentException, E
      Executes the provided cmd in a synchronized manner on the provided mutex. This method is useful when you want to run a piece of code that might throw an exception and you need to ensure that the execution is synchronized. It allows you to handle exceptions in a specific way by providing a runnable task that can throw an exception.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of the mutex.
      E - The type of the exception that the cmd might throw.
      Parameters:
      mutex - The object on which the synchronized operations are to be performed.
      cmd - The runnable task that might throw an exception.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the provided mutex or cmd is null.
      E - if an exception occurs during the execution of the cmd.

    • call

      public static <T, R, E extends Throwable> R call(T mutex, Throwables.Callable<R,E> cmd) throws IllegalArgumentException, E
      Executes the provided cmd in a synchronized manner on the provided mutex and returns the result. This method is useful when you want to run a piece of code that might throw an exception, you need the result of that code, and you need to ensure that the execution is synchronized. It allows you to handle exceptions in a specific way by providing a callable task that can throw an exception and returns a result.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of the mutex.
      R - The type of the result.
      E - The type of the exception that the cmd might throw.
      Parameters:
      mutex - The object on which the synchronized operations are to be performed.
      cmd - The callable task that might throw an exception and returns a result.
      Returns:
      The result of the cmd.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the provided mutex or cmd is null.
      E - if an exception occurs during the execution of the cmd.

    • test

      public static <T, E extends Throwable> boolean test(T mutex, Throwables.Predicate<? super T,E> predicate) throws IllegalArgumentException, E
      Tests the provided predicate in a synchronized manner on the provided mutex and returns the result. This method is useful when you want to test a condition that might throw an exception and you need to ensure that the execution is synchronized. It allows you to handle exceptions in a specific way by providing a predicate that can throw an exception and returns a boolean result.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of the mutex.
      E - The type of the exception that the predicate might throw.
      Parameters:
      mutex - The object on which the synchronized operations are to be performed.
      predicate - The predicate that might throw an exception and returns a boolean result.
      Returns:
      The result of the predicate.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the provided mutex or predicate is null.
      E - if an exception occurs during the execution of the predicate.

    • test

      public static <T, U, E extends Throwable> boolean test(T mutex, U u, Throwables.BiPredicate<? super T,? super U,E> predicate) throws IllegalArgumentException, E
      Tests the provided predicate in a synchronized manner on the provided mutex and returns the result. This method is useful when you want to test a condition that might throw an exception and you need to ensure that the execution is synchronized. It allows you to handle exceptions in a specific way by providing a bi-predicate that can throw an exception and returns a boolean result.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of the mutex.
      U - The type of the second argument to the predicate.
      E - The type of the exception that the predicate might throw.
      Parameters:
      mutex - The object on which the synchronized operations are to be performed.
      u - The second argument to the predicate. This argument should be of type U.
      predicate - The bi-predicate that might throw an exception and returns a boolean result.
      Returns:
      The result of the predicate.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the provided mutex or predicate is null.
      E - if an exception occurs during the execution of the predicate.
